main.name: Scott Harvey
main.description: I want to apply my 19 years of experience using older technologies such as Adobe ColdFusion, MS SQL Server, and Oracle to a modern paradigm as a Full Stack Developer working with the MERN (MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js) stack. I am currently enrolled in the Full Stack Developer bootcamp at Hyperion Dev and will be completing the bootcamp in June of 2019.
main.bio:
I'm dry-humored and the most socialable introvert you will meet - for example - my partner and I have been to over 25 weddings together. I enjoy traveling and still find it amazing that I have been fortunate enough to travel to about 30 countries on 6 continents - most recently Nepal and Indonesia.

I enjoy developing with ColdFusion because it is relatively easy and feature rich. It is a shame that Adobe hasn't done more for ColdFusion. Perhaps they should open source their version of CFML in order to get more developers involved and boost the profile of ColdFusion. Then again, ColdFusion is essentially a Java framework so perhaps touting that could help ColdFusion could raise its profile.

Currently, I am attending a bootcamp where I am learning the MERN stack. It will be nice to have another tool in my toolbox and the potential opportunities that come with it. I think an ideal opportunity would be one where I get to use my knowledge of ColdFusion and could work on porting the application to the MERN stack or (a similar stack).

Professionally, I value a sense of ownership most of all. The position that I recall most fondly was at CLR where I built an intranet for them from the ground up. I was responsible for all aspects of the project - managing web hosting including database and web server setup, database architecture / design, and software development. As I automated CLR's processes I felt great pride to be able to develop software that was fostering communication between employees and making work easier for them.

I enjoy a challenge and I believe that if you aren't in a little over your head you will not grow. I'm looking for the next challenge.
main.contactmessage: If you like what you see - please get in touch! I'd love to hear about any potential opportunities for freelance work, partnership, or employment.

Staging new modules for client approval prior to moving the module to production. New modules include featured blog posts, client testimonials, and an image rotator that gets its data from HubDB database queries.

The survey and reporting tools include Development Survey, Faculty Salary Survey, GME Track, and Student Record System. The tools were built using a combination of ColdFusion, Oracle, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS.

projects.category: A project for the React / Express section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description:
This project was for the Full Stack Developer bootcamp I did. The assignment was to create an app that allows the user to choose between two functions – a currency converter and a Three-card Monte game.

The currency converter fetches the current exchange rates from https://apilayer.com/ in order to convert currency between US Dollars, Euros, Pounds Sterling, and South African Rands.

The Three-Card Monte game is a simple game of chance that gives feedback about the winning or losing streak.

The app should get the weather by fetching the OpenWeatherMap API: https://openweathermap.org/current.
